servinfo.title: Transmission Fluid Temperature Sensor Removal and Installation

s1.ptxt: Pull out fluid level gauge and lift up vehicle.
Remove drain plug and drain A/T fluid.
Install drain plug with new gasket.
Remove oil filler tube (2) and A/T oil pan (1).
Disconnect shift solenoid–A connector (1), shift solenoid–B connector (2), TCC pressure control solenoid connector (4) and Pressure control solenoid connector (3).
After removing bolt (1) pull out transmission wire connector (2) from transmission case.

attention2.ptxt: When pulling transmission wire harness out of transmission case, take care not to damage connectors and transmission fluid temperature sensor at narrow exist of case. Careless sensor treatment might cause sensor malfunction.

servinfosub.title: Installation
servinfosub.ptxt: Remove removal procedure to install transmission fluid temperature sensor, noting the following points.

item.ptxt: For details of solenoid valves and their connectors installation, refer to Automatic Transmission Unit Assembly . Use new O-ring.
For details of A/T oil pan installation, refer to Automatic Transmission Unit Assembly .
Fill A/T fluid and check fluid level according to procedure described in A/T Fluid Change .
Check for fluid leakage after warming up A/T.
Tighten transmission wire connector bolt to specified torque referring to Automatic Transmission Unit Assembly .
